div.ab: But because the fingers do not press evenly, for one if you press on the edges, the middle will remain hollow. Begin, therefore, by the middle, & then follow the edges. But to make it better, put on the medal something flat & smooth, or some large square file e, & press with this, for you will press equally, sometimes after l with your knee, other times with your foot with your shoe taken off, & make the bone be on top; thus you lâ€™emprand will imprint it without breaking it. If, on the first go, it is not molded well, return to it several times. Then, repair & smooth on the sides your d halves of molded bone. & And to cut it well, always begin coming from the softest part to the scales. And if your medal does not come out by itself, scratch the bone from the back, which is rugged, and it will release. When you want to cast, secure & join your two bones with some small points of wood, &c. But to mold very neatly, there is only our sand.
